lead: Exploring the intersection of technology and health, from AI-driven platforms to sleep tracking advancements.

stories.title: South Australian startup Splose raises $46 million in another Series A
stories.summary: Splose, a South Australian startup, has successfully raised $46 million in a Series A funding round to enhance its AI-driven allied health platform. This funding will support the growth of their services aimed at improving health outcomes through innovative technology. The investment reflects a growing interest in health tech startups that leverage artificial intelligence to deliver better patient care.

stories.title: How to track your sleep and view your sleep data in Apple Health
stories.summary: Apple Health has streamlined sleep tracking by integrating features that allow users to monitor their sleep patterns using an iPhone and Apple Watch. The setup process is user-friendly, enabling detailed analysis of sleep stages and trends over time. This functionality not only helps users understand their sleep quality but also promotes better sleep hygiene through consistent tracking and reminders.

stories.title: Apple reportedly axed its planned AI health coach
stories.summary: Apple has reportedly shelved its plans for an AI health coach that aimed to replicate a doctor's guidance. Following organizational changes, the company decided to focus on releasing individual features for its Health app instead. This decision reflects the competitive landscape of health tech, where many companies are already offering advanced health monitoring solutions.

stories.title: Public Health Workers Are Quitting Over Assignments to Guantánamo
stories.summary: A growing number of public health workers are resigning in protest against being assigned to work in controversial ICE detention centers, including Guantánamo. This situation sheds light on the ethical dilemmas faced by healthcare professionals in politically charged environments. The resignations highlight the challenges within public health sectors, particularly regarding the treatment of vulnerable populations.

stories.title: 7 Steps to Better Financial Health You Can Take Right Now
stories.summary: As the year begins, it’s an opportune time to reassess personal finances. This guide outlines actionable steps individuals can take to improve their financial health, emphasizing the importance of budgeting and saving. By taking control of financial habits, one can enhance overall well-being, which is intrinsically linked to health.

stories.title: The Latest Apple Watch Is $100 Off
stories.summary: The Apple Watch Series 11 is currently available at a $100 discount, making it an appealing option for those interested in upgrading their health tracking devices. This model includes advanced health features such as enhanced sleep tracking and hypertension alerts, appealing to users focused on wellness.

stories.title: The Apple Watch Series 11 is down to a record-low price
stories.summary: The Apple Watch Series 11 has hit a record-low price, making it an attractive buy for health-conscious consumers. With features like sleep scoring and health metrics, this smartwatch aims to support users in achieving their health goals. The discount comes at a time when many are looking to invest in their health and fitness.

stories.title: From ‘nerdy’ Gemini to ‘edgy’ Grok: how developers are shaping AI behaviours
stories.summary: The development of AI assistants is raising ethical questions about their behavior and the implications for users. As AI technologies evolve, the character and responses of these systems are being fine-tuned, which could significantly impact mental health and user interactions. The ongoing debate highlights the need for responsible AI development in health-related applications.
